Various improvements and bug fixes With a fresh new look and cutting edge AI technology Goodnotes 6 is the ultimate replacement for paper notebooks. The perfect partner for your studies work or overall organization. Feature highlights: Detect and correct your spelling mistakes in your handwritten notes with world s first generative AI features built for handwriting. New pen gestures: Scribble to Erase and Circle to Lasso. Personalize your folders with icons and colors. Customize the paper size and color of your notebook covers and papers. Full page typing mode with AI to paraphrase to change the tone or to make your text shorter or longer. A new Marketplace to discover hundreds of new items designed by creators all over the world. SAT Math practice questions with our AI Math assistance that can spot mistakes in your handwritten equations.

Introducing Elements Save and reuse frequently needed objects across all of your notebooks. Stickers stamps headers sticky notes basic shapes graphs coordinate systems... When taking notes we need to use the same objects over and over again. The new Elements feature lets you import and save objects or groups of objects to a collection from where you can add them to the page again. No more copy and paste between different notebooks or hectic redrawing when time is short. SAVING ELEMENTS GoodNotes comes with some built in Element collections that you can use to decorate or enhance your notes. Of course you can also add your own elements: 1. Select something with the Lasso Tool tap on the selection again tap Add as Element 2. Select an image with the Image tool Then tap on it again Add as Element 3. Open the Elements picker tap and hold on the mini thumbnail of a collection at the bottom Edit Import images from Camera Roll or Files INSERTING ELEMENTS Inserting elements work similarly to inserting images with the image tool: Select the Elements tool tap anywhere on the page select the Element you want to insert. You can also use drag and drop to add elements from the Elements picker or from the contextual area that includes your recently used Elements for faster access. Tips for Pros: When you save an Element the format is preserved which means all objects are fully editable when you add them back to a page. For example you can save a hand drawn table with placeholder text boxes for the table headers. After adding the Element to the page you can update the placeholder text with the text tool or erase columns you don t need. ORGANIZING ELEMENTS Elements are organized in collections. When saving an element you can choose to add it to an existing collection or create a new one. You can delete Elements in collections move them around and import more. You can learn more about how to use Elements by visiting our blog on medium.goodnotes.com and following us on Instagram goodnotes.app and on Twitter goodnotesapp .

This update fixes an issue with indexing new documents and notes for searching. Previous release notes: Study With Flash Cards GoodNotes lets you create flash cards that you can study with the Spaced Repetition learning technique. To create a flash card add a new page using the Flash Card paper template Flash card paper is currently only available in the size GoodNotes Standard Size and can be found in the Essentials template group all the way on the right side Add the question on the top half and the answer on the bottom half. Tip: Use images text and handwriting to create great looking and information rich flash cards. To study all flash cards in a document the flash card deck tap on the ... menu and then on Study Flash Cards Tap on the screen to reveal the answer and then choose how easy it was to remember the answer. GoodNotes will suggest your next study date based on your learning progress and the selected difficulty of the cards. The more you study the more accurate these suggestions will become. E.g.: You will see hard cards more often and sooner than easy cards. You can reset your entire learning progress for the current deck in the settings in the flash card studying screen. Note that this is not reversible and the entire progress for this deck is lost as if you would have never studied it before. Other fixes improvements added a dialogue for when there are incompatible sync versions installed that isn t blocking you from using GoodNotes Fixed crashes related to the new shape and text features Fixed the multi selection gesture for the library and page

This build includes several bug fixes and performance improvements as well as a new experimental feature: Flash Cards. Study With Flash Cards GoodNotes lets you create flash cards that you can study with the Spaced Repetition learning technique. To create a flash card add a new page using the Flash Card paper template Flash card paper is currently only available in the size GoodNotes Standard Size and can be found in the Essentials template group all the way on the right side Add the question on the top half and the answer on the bottom half. Tip: Use images text and handwriting to create great looking and information rich flash cards. To study all flash cards in a document the flash card deck tap on the ... menu and then on Study Flash Cards Tap on the screen to reveal the answer and then choose how easy it was to remember the answer. GoodNotes will suggest your next study date based on your learning progress and the selected difficulty of the cards. The more you study the more accurate these suggestions will become. E.g.: You will see hard cards more often and sooner than easy cards. You can reset your entire learning progress for the current deck in the settings in the flash card studying screen. Note that this is not reversible and the entire progress for this deck is lost as if you would have never studied it before. Other fixes improvements added a dialogue for when there are incompatible sync versions installed that isn t blocking you from using GoodNotes Fixed crashes related to the new shape and text features Fixed the multi selection gesture for the library and page

We re excited to introduce improved shape drawing and updates to the text tool: Draw and hold with the pen and highlighter support for curves subsequent shape editing faster text style selection text box drop shadow and more. Here s what s new: Draw and hold Draw a stroke with the pen or highlighter tool and hold down with your finger or stylus at the end of the stroke to convert it to a perfect shape or line Continue holding down and drag your finger stylus across the screen to resize or rotate the shape This adds back the ability to draw shapes with the highlighter that many of you missed from GoodNotes 4 Select shapes Tap on a shape using your finger or the shapes tool to select it You can now edit it using the points on the lines To resize or rotate a shape use the lasso tool Draw curves We re introducing curves as a new shape in this update You can change the slope of a curve when editing it More options for shape drawing You can disable Draw and Hold in the pen tool options. Tap on the pen tool icon in the toolbar twice to access them Strokes you draw can snap to other stroke endpoints which allows you to create perfect shapes with multiple strokes. If the shape is closed it can be selected and edited as a whole instead of only selecting the single lines New selected state for text boxes Tapping on a text box once will select it so that you can make edits to the text box as a whole without bringing up the keyboard right away You can move selected text boxes or change the style easily Double tap on a text box to start typing New toolbar layout and styles The text tool receives an improved contextual area so that the style options are easier to access A new drop shadow option has been added to the text box style options We updated the FontAPI so that custom system fonts are now visible in GoodNotes 5 on iOS 14
This version includes changes that require updating GoodNotes on all your devices. Minor adjustments to look and feel of document tabs Minor improvements related to iCloud sync Other minor bug fixes
This version fixes a bug where unexpected sync loop of certain documents might happen if GoodNotes is opened on multiple devices.
Bug fixes and performance improvements
Bugfixes and performance improvements
Bugfixes and performance improvements.

This version fixes freeze and writing lag issues during sync INTRODUCING SHARED DOCUMENTS Finding new ways to work together with other people is now more important than ever. This update adds the ability to share documents with other GoodNotes users and edit them together. How to share a document 1. Open a document in GoodNotes and tap on the Share icon 2. Tap on Collaborate and enable Link Sharing 3. Copy the link to your clipboard or send it directly to other people so that they can open it on their iOS iPadOS devices and accept the shared document You can find more information on all new features and instructions on how to use them on goodnotes.com shared documents What you can use shared documents for Shared documents are incredibly versatile. Here s some inspiration what you could use them for: Ask someone else to leave comments an annotations on a PDF document you drafted Share notes with your classmates to check if you understood everything from your last lecture correctly Collect signatures or feedback on a document from a group of people Make your meeting notes available to your entire team immediately Share grocery shopping lists calendars journals and more with your family members Read and annotate a book together Correct someone s homework Brainstorm with your team Play Tic Tac Toe or Battleships with friends Plan a home renovation project and even share it with your interior designer to get their feedback Changes to shared documents sync via iCloud and take around 15 30 seconds to show up on other devices. Currently anyone with the link can open and edit a shared document in GoodNotes. We recommend sharing documents with trusted people only. Happy sharing! OTHER RELEASE NOTES added a page number indicator when scrolling. This can be disabled in Menu Settings Document Editing fixed a crash that happened occasionally when exporting documents fixed some minor design issues

Fixed some issues where the app is crashing on launch Added detection when the app is crashing multiple times on launch for troubleshooting Previous release notes: INTRODUCING AUTO BACKUP IN GOODNOTES 5 Auto Backup uploads the latest version of your documents in PDF and or GoodNotes format to one of the following cloud storages automatically: Google Drive Dropbox or OneDrive. In GoodNotes 5 we added the option to backup in both formats at the same time so that you can access your documents as PDF versions from anywhere but still have a copy in GoodNotes format that you can further edit and change with GoodNotes on any device. Auto backup is a one directional sync that saves a copy of your documents in the selected cloud storage where you can access them. Changes you make to the backup in your cloud storages will not sync with GoodNotes on your iPad or iPhone. HOW TO ENABLE AUTO BACKUP 1. Enable Automatic Backup in GoodNotes Menu Settings Automatic Backup 2. Chose to sign into a cloud storage 3. Select your desired cloud storage 4. Type in your account details 5. Optionally change the file format or the destination folder in the same menu To learn more about auto backup visit goodnotes.com auto backup.

Fixed Temporary Diagnostic Mode not working as intended Fixed a crash on launch issue Fixed a bug when exporting larger documents in GoodNotes format Release notes of 5.3.18: Fixed a bug from update 5.3.17 where some PDF links weren t working Release notes of 5.3.17: Important notice: After installing this update please also install the GoodNotes version 5.3.17 or higher on all of your other devices that sync with the same iCloud account. We made improvements to PDF text indexing that require GoodNotes to be on the latest version on all devices. Otherwise you ll see a warning that sync is not working. Other changes in this update: improved import dialogue when sending documents to GoodNotes from another app Added an option to disable automatic opening of newly imported documents under Menu Settings Document Editing Reduced battery drain when indexing new PDF files When exporting a document via email the subject line of the email will now be the document title by default Fixed a bug with double tap to undo near the screen edges Updated the button for adding pages on the navigation bar Other internal changes performance and stability improvements

Show sync indicator on an empty library when iCloud is syncing Fixed repeating crashes related to handwriting indexing Fixed a bug that causes webpages not to import properly sometimes when using the Open In GoodNotes action GoodNotes will now open the first page of an appended documents automatically Adjusted the appearance of the button that allows exiting full screen Fixed dismissing long press menu would leave a dot on the page or would toggle the full screen mode.

Fixes in 5.3.3 Fixed occasional crashes while writing with fountain or brush pen. Fixed occasional crashes when indexing PDF documents. Further fine tuned dragging and dropping tabs across windows. Introducing multiple windows in GoodNotes requires iPadOS You can now open GoodNotes in multiple windows to view two documents side by side view two pages of the same document in Split View or pair it with other apps in spaces across your entire iPad. To open a new window drag any of the elements listed below to the side of your screen: the app icon from the dock documents from the library folders from the library individual pages from the document thumbnail view tabs from the tab bar You can also use the buttons in the library action menu or from the tab bar to open a new window. If you re using presentation mode we highly recommend you to check out the tips we shared on goodnotes.com ipad os to learn more about how you can leverage your presentations with multiple windows. OCR document scanning requires iOS 13 iPadOS Tap the button in the library or in the document navigation bar to open your device s camera and use it to scan paper documents. GoodNotes recognizes printed text in all Latin based languages making it searchable. iPadOS system gestures for undo redo multi select Swipe left with three fingers to undo the last edit and right to redo the last edit. Place two fingers in the library view or thumbnail view and then start swiping to select multiple items quickly Dark Mode new paper templates requires iOS 13 iPadOS Activating Dark Mode in the control center will give GoodNotes a cool new look that is easier on the eyes. We also introduced a new set of dark paper templates to GoodNotes that you can choose from the template library when creating a new notebook adding pages to existing documents or changing the paper template of the current page. Existing background colors of pages won t change automatically because the color is static.

Fix occasional writing lag. Also in 5.2: INTRODUCING PRESENTATION MODE GoodNotes 5 now supports Presentation Mode. It lets you convert your iPad into a distraction free digital whiteboard for more engaging presentations classes and lectures. Presentation mode lets you hide all distractions on an external screen when you connect your device via HDMI or AirPlay. Details: Laser Pointer is now always available in the swipeable toolbar Laser Pointer supports two different styles: dot and trail Presentation Mode supports three preferences that determine what your audience sees on the external screen Presentation Mode preference can be set under the Share button You can find more information about presentation mode including tips guides and best practices on goodnotes.com presentation mode.

Fixed left margin dashed line doesn t appear inside zoom window. Fixed zoom window s auto advance occasionally move outside of the page. Updated zoom window behavior to not shrink its height when it is pulled down. Also in 5.2: INTRODUCING PRESENTATION MODE GoodNotes 5 now supports Presentation Mode. It lets you convert your iPad into a distraction free digital whiteboard for more engaging presentations classes and lectures. Presentation mode lets you hide all distractions on an external screen when you connect your device via HDMI or AirPlay. fixed a problem from the previous update where the page wouldn t scroll properly when zoomed in Previous fixes: fixed occasional crashes when backing up manually improved page loading speed on pages with many handwritten notes Renamed documents now keep their name when reimported pages now stop immediately when touching the screen during vertical scrolling improved tap to toggle full screen when in reading mode

fixed occasional crashes when backing up manually improved page loading speed on pages with many handwritten notes Renamed documents now keep their name when reimported pages now stop immediately when touching the screen during vertical scrolling improved tap to toggle full screen when in reading mode

added the ability to rename outline items: Swipe from right to left on the item in the outlines tab or tap on the down arrow next to the page in thumbnail view to manage outline items photos and images you add as pages are now in GoodNotes standard size handwriting recognition can now be disabled when exporting PDFs

In this update we added gesture control for undo and redo. Here s how it works: Tap the screen twice with two fingers to undo your last edit Tap the screen twice with three fingers to redo your last edit Both gestures work anywhere on the paper also while writing in the Zoom Window.

added a new icon for text formatting option in the contextual area of the text tool added save as default button for text formatting. New text boxes will always start with the default format. fixed some common text tool bugs fixed occasional incorrect page positions after copying and pasting pages improved page scrolling animation when stopping the scroll by tapping the screen

In this update we added some minor fixes and improvements. We also made some changes that help us detecting corrupted documents faster so that we can help to recover them. The changes in this update are quite boring so maybe you ll find something more interesting on our social media channels or on our blog. We share tips tricks and inspiration around GoodNotes on a regular basis. You can find our blog on medium.goodnotes.com and we re on Instagram and on Twitter as goodnotesapp.
Fixed eraser performance on complex PDF pages
In this version we ve improved the rendering speed for PDFs. This will load large PDF files much faster which are often used by architects in construction or for digital planning.

fixed: Can t turn pages when something is selected with the lasso tool fixed: Can t long press on empty areas in a PDF to take a screenshot Tip: To show the contextual menu of the Lasso Tool screenshot copy cut etc. you only need to tap on the selection once. Tapping and holding is not necessary as this triggers the drag drop interactions.
fixed a problem where internal hyperlinks on copied pages wouldn t link to the original page fixed a bug that caused images to disappear from the contextual area of the image camera tool

double tapping the screen with one finger while Apple Pencil is connected will now center the page and adjust the width to full width of the current page improved performance for full text search on pages with lots of notes improved text box behavior: the page will now automatically scroll to the right position so that the text box is always visible
fixed a bug with the data reparation for corrupted documents fixed a crash when importing particular PDF documents text box editing will now be finished by dismissing the screen keyboard as well

added support for importing custom templates from Photos introduced a faster way for selecting objects with the lasso tool. Selections don t have to be deselected manually before selecting other objects fixed a bug where text boxes would still be selected when scrolling to other pages added an animation for transitioning from document to library view so that it is easier to find the closed document again improved loading speed for document thumbnails in the library

fixed a bug that causes document corruption with some custom templates more minor fixes and improvements Previous release notes from 5.0.22: Fixed undo issues when a document is closed and opened again. Fixed stray line issue when writing with Apple Pencil. Improved support for Dynamic Type and VoiceOver. Pen thickness can now be adjusted with 0.05mm increments. Minor improvements to overall stabilities.

Fixed undo issues when document is closed and opened again. Fixed stray line issue when writing with Apple Pencil. Improved support for Dynamic Type and VoiceOver. Pen thickness can now be adjusted with 0.05mm increments. Minor improvements to overall stabilities.

In this update we fixed a bug that caused document corruption after failing to import Office documents. This bug resulted in the following symptoms in the corrupted documents: New pages were added to incorrect positions in the document Some pages couldn t be added to Favorites Pages couldn t be moved Pages couldn t be deleted Pages couldn t be copied with the alert Page is not found Blank documents after reinstalling the app Incorrect page numbers Recovering already corrupted documents: We will release another update in a few days that will allow you to recover already corrupted documents. Until then please do not reinstall GoodNotes or restore from an iCloud backup. This will prevent the recovery from working. If you need to work with the corrupted documents in the meantime export them as PDF and import them again if possible. Further fixes and improvements in this version: Fix a crash when exporting folders without document inside Improved status bar tap behavior with vertical scrolling. Tapping the status bar won t scroll to the top of the document anymore but to the top of the current page. Added support for dynamic type in More ... menu

fixed a bug where text boxes would move under images fixed a crash when dragging objects and dropping from one document to another fixed failing backup when backing up large libraries ZipFoundation.Archive.ArchiveError 4
fixed a bug that caused cropped images in imported GoodNotes 4 documents to disappear added support for exporting whole folders from the library minor design updates
fixed an issue where the Apple Pencil would automatically disconnect when Bluetooth is deactivated in the control center of iOS fixed a bug where the color of ink can t be changed after pasting it
This update fixes layering issue when using lasso tool and image tool.
This update includes a fix for a crash that happened to some users when opening the app

This update adds the bookmarks feature from GoodNotes 4 now called Custom Outlines . How to use Custom Outlines Document outlines allow you to quickly navigate to specific pages in your documents from the Outlines tab in the thumbnail view. You can add pages to the document outline and set a name for them by following one of the options below: 1. Tap on the ... button in the navigation bar of an open page and tap Add this page to Outline 2. Open the thumbnail view and tap on the arrow next to the page number and tap Add Page to Outline You will then be asked to insert a title for the outline item which will appear next to the page in the thumbnail view and in the outlines tab. A page can be added to the outline multiple times and thus can have multiple labels. To remove an outline item in the Outlines tab swipe from right to left on the item. Migrating old bookmarks from V4 to Outline Items If you migrated your GoodNotes 4 documents to GoodNotes 5 your old bookmarks were converted to Favorites . You can convert them to Outline items in Menu Settings Document Editing. Favorites you added in GoodNotes 5 won t be affected by this conversion. Other fixes improvements in 5.0.15 Fixed freezes after exporting to Mail app Fixed freeze when using the text tool Fixed unexpected Bluetooth alert when Bluetooth is disabled in Settings Optimized eraser performance

This minor update improved overall stabilities. Previous fixes: fixed a crash when editing a page occasionally. fixed writing lags affected some users fixed an issue that caused images to disappear when copying and pasting pages improved the speed of opening documents and loading and closing document titles changed some wordings and made some cosmetic improvements fixed lag when writing on the first page of a document fixed a bug that caused notes to reappear after erasing them fixed a crash that was caused by typing with the text tool fixed a crash that happened for some people when opening the app You can find more information about known issues troubleshooting how to guides and more on support.goodnotes.com.

This update fixed lags when writing on the front page and a bug that caused notes to reappear after erasing.

This update improves the writing scrolling and erasing experience in GoodNotes 5 as well as other bug fixes. We also fixed a bug from version 5.0.4 where imported PDF files and new notebooks showed up blank after using the image tool.

This release is fixing a lot of the existing bugs and crashes. We also added further stability improvements and made sure that GoodNotes 5 will now show the correct file size in your iCloud storage. We re working hard to improve GoodNotes 5 further for you and on adding back the features you re missing from GoodNotes 4. You can find how to guides about GoodNotes 5 answers to FAQ troubleshooting help and other useful resources on support.goodnotes.com.

Introducing the all new GoodNotes 5 A single place for all your formerly paper based information. GoodNotes 5 is a major update to its predecessor GoodNotes 4. It includes many highly requested features improvements to existing things and some special surprises. What s new in GoodNotes 5: New folder system: Create unlimited levels of folders and subfolders Text handwriting search across all documents Flexible scrolling directions: Horizontal or vertical scrolling Favorites view: Shortcuts to important pages documents or folders. QuickNotes: The fastest way to start taking notes Optionally display documents as lists instead of thumbnails Improved ink algorithm: More precise and natural writing experience New pen style: Brush Pen for artistic sketches and notes Improved Shapes tool: Color fill shapes and make lines snap Rebuilt toolbar: Faster access to all tools and settings Handwriting rotation: rotate handwriting and sketches with the Lasso Tool Better rich text editing more fonts: Use various colors font sizes and styles in a single text box Flexible image resizing Smarter eraser: Optionally only erase highlighting strokes More covers and paper templates Fresh modern design increased stability performance and a lot more To read more about what s new in GoodNotes 5 visit our blog on medium.goodnotes.com or our website goodnotes.com.
